metadata.title: CVE-2024-50092 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: netconsole: fix wrong warningA warning is triggered when there is insufficient space in the bufferfor userdata. However, this is not an issue since userdata will be sentin the next iteration.Current warning message:    ------------[ cut here ]------------     WARNING: CPU: 13 PID: 3013042 at drivers/net/netconsole.c:1122write_ext_msg+0x3b6/0x3d0      ? write_ext_msg+0x3b6/0x3d0      console_flush_all+0x1e9/0x330The code incorrectly issues a warning when this_chunk is zero, which isa valid scenario. The warning should only be triggered when this_chunkis negative.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-50092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-2001-raspi-realtime - 6.7.0-2001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-realtime - 6.8.0-1008.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
